title: Mathematical Problem-Solving Optimization Strategies Applying Cognitive Load and Workload Theories

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics knowledge and core cognitive psychology concepts
context.additional_context: Program focusing on systematically analyzing cognitive load in mathematical problem-solving processes to develop efficient learning strategies

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and measure intrinsic/extrinsic/germane cognitive loads occurring during mathematical problem-solving processes.
Learners can analyze how job load factors affect mathematical problem-solving efficiency through experimental research and surveys.
Learners can design customized problem-solving strategies applying cognitive load theory and apply them to real-world cases.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
